title: BBC Local Live: Sheffield and South Yorkshire on Friday 27 November 2015 - BBC News
summary: three women killed in crash at former maltby colliery junction .
doncaster children 's services rated 'inadequate ' by ofsted .
abuse inquiry judge announces first investigations .
doncaster mp caroline flint criticises corbyn on syria .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: thanks for joining us today .
we 'll have more news , sport , weather and travel updates from across the county from 08:00 on monday 30 november .
and get in touch with your and stories .
like this photo of a mystical grey graves park in sheffield from michelle hayter .
author: Kate Linderholm
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sheffield academics discover 'hazardous ' everest lakes
text: lakes that have been forming near mount everest could threaten settlements downstream if they overflow , according to a team of academics from sheffield and leeds .
the scientists say the warning is the first of its kind for khumbu where ponds ( on the surface of the glacier in the himalayas have expanded and joined together to form larger bodies of water .

`` at present , the glacier appears to be disintegrating , and may form a few large and potentially hazardous lakes on the glacier surface , '' says ann rowan , who led the field study team from the universities of sheffield and leeds .

carlos carvalhal : `` we need eleven gladiators against blackburn '' # swfc

documents.title: coming up on look north : analysis of doncaster children 's services report
text: on look north tonight i 'll have analysis on the latest damning ofsted report on doncaster children 's services and an interview with john harris ( from the safeguarding children board in doncaster .
concerns about the department have been in the news for the best part of a decade .
a string of deaths of vulnerable children meant the council was put into special measures , not able to control its own department .
in 2013 the government decided to make that permanent , forcing them the set up an independent trust .
today 's inspection result wo n't be surprising for those who 've followed the story of doncaster from its lowest point .
but the trust and council both say the inspection shows they are making progress .
author: James Vincent
Reporter BBC Look North

documents.title: travel : traffic slow as a630 in doncaster blocked
text: warmsworth road in doncaster blocked and slow traffic inbound beteen the barrel lane junction and the ivanhoe junction .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: tram train track approved by deparrtment for transport
text: plans to build a section of railway track that 'll allow the country 's first tram trains to run in south yorkshire , have been approved by the department for transport .
the new vehicles are being built at this factory in spain .
the .
section of track , known as the tinsley chord , will allow supertram to operate services from sheffield city centre through to rotherham .
the project is around a year behind schedule .
services should start in 2017 .
author: Kate Linderholm
BBC Local Live

documents.title: maltby triple fatal crash : police name one of the victims
text: police have named one of the three women who died in yesterday 's car crash at maltby as 58-year-old diana maria hunt from the hatfield area .
she was the driver of a toyota aygo which was involved in the collision with another car and van .

two other women who died in the crash have been formally identified but their families have asked that their details are not released while extended family members are informed of the deaths , police said .
officers want to hear from anyone who saw the accident on the a631 tickhill road around half past five yesterday evening .

( a616 worksop ) because of people slowing to look at an accident .

documents.title: latest headlines : children 's services 'inadequate ' and bad smell in rotherham
text: the top stories in sheffield and south yorkshire this afternoon include :

documents.title: mystery rotherham pong 'making people poorly '
text: people in a number of villages in rotherham say a foul smell is making them ill .
the noxious odour has been affecting areas around wales , kiveton and harthill .
rotherham council is trying to trace the source which appears to be over the border in killamarsh , north east derbyshire .
the reverend gary schofield says he 's really frustrated because the smell is so bad and it 's lasted for such a long time .
he described the odour to bbc radio sheffield :
it smells a bit like something that 's been burnt , that 's a bit off .
it 's not just a bad odour that 's in the air under your nose , but it 's an odour that actually penetrates your body and people are breathing it in and struggling with their breathing .
author: Kate Linderholm
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tram train 's long journey from spain to south yorkshire
text: the long journey of the uk 's first tram train from the manufacturers in spain to south yorkshire reaches the uk tomorrow .
the 37m long vehicle is making a two-week voyage over land and sea from valencia , via santander , southampton , and the m1 motorway before arriving in south yorkshire on 1 december .
passengers in sheffield and rotherham will be the first in the uk to benefit from the tram-type vehicle that can run on both street tram lines and the rail network .

documents.title: weather : severe weather warnings
text: we 've got a windy and cold weekend in store with rain at times .
thought you might want to know there are some warnings out from the met office .
author: Keeley Donovan
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

text: a621 south yorkshire , a621 abbeydale road closed and slow traffic in both directions between archer road junction and the woodseats road junction because of an accident .

documents.title: watch : what happens to your black friday orders ?
text: as shoppers nationwide place millions of orders for black friday deals , we give you a glimpse behind the scenes at the amazon warehouse as staff battle to meet demand .

documents.title: doncaster children 's services : mp says 'long way to go '
text: the labour mp for don valley says there 's still a lot more to be done to improve children 's services in doncaster .
a new inspection report from ofsted says that children 's services are still inadequate .
an independent trust is now in charge of the service .
the government took it away from the local council two years ago after a number of high profile cases of neglect .
don valley mp caroline flint admits there is still much to do :
i 've met with people from the new trust .
i obviously have my own case work i deal with for families that are involved .
i think it is improving but there 's a long way to go to restore trust in the services in doncaster in this particular area . ''
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: doncaster children 's services rated 'inadequate '
text: coming up on look north at lunchtime we 'll be looking at the inspectors report rating children 's services in doncaster as inadequate
also at 13:30 a look ahead to the football this weekend .
there 's more at stake than is even usually the case , when barnsley host sheffield united at oakwell tomorrow lunchtime .
author: BBC Look North, Yorkshire

documents.title: abuse inquiry : churches and 'prominent people ' to be investigated
text: the anglican and catholic churches and `` people of public prominence '' are to be investigated by the inquiry into child sexual abuse , its chair has said .
justice lowell goddard said councils in lambeth , nottinghamshire and rochdale councils will also be examined as part of 12 separate investigations in england and wales .
the inquiry was set up in the wake of the jay report into the sexual exploitation of 1,400 children in rotherham .

documents.title: doncaster labour mp criticises corbyn over syria
text: don valley mp caroline flint has criticised labour leader jeremy corbyn for his letter opposing air strikes against so-called islamic state in syria .
speaking on bbc radio sheffield caroline flint said :
i do n't think sending out that letter helped in terms of reaching the common ground .
i do think we need to take military action .
there has to be a wider plan . ''

documents.title: travel : disruption m1 southbound in rotherham
text: disruption between j33 for a630 , catcliffe rotherham and j32 for m18 upper whiston .
m1 south yorkshire - one lane and queuing traffic due to a broken down vehicle .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: city gangs 'at all levels of criminality ' says police chief
text: in the wake of the jordan thomas murder trial , supt shaun morley of south yorkshire police has revealed the scale of the problem the city faces with criminal gangs :

currently , sheffield has a number of identified and recognised gangs operating at all levels of criminality , ranging from low-level antisocial behaviour to serious acquisitive crime , drug dealing and firearms offences .
the gangs operate across various geographical areas within the city and consist of members ranging from their teens through to their forties .
he goes on to say in the last five years there have been 30 serious and fatal firearms offences in sheffield which is actually a reduction from the previous five years when they reached 62 .
author: Kate Linderholm
BBC Local Live

documents.title: gang warfare in sheffield 'kills and injures 30 in five years '
text: police have dealt with 30 fatal and serious firearm offences in sheffield over the past five years , it has emerged today .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: maltby crash scene : police seek witnesses
text: i 'm at the site of the crash on the a631 tickhill road in malby where three women were killed yesterday evening .
two cars and a vehicle collided at the entrance to the old maltby pit .
police are urging witnesses to the accident to contact them .
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: latest headlines : three dead in maltby crash and more bonfire night disorder arrests
text: the top stories in sheffield and south yorkshire :

documents.title: abbeydale road disorder : three more teenagers arrested
text: south yorkshire police today arrested three more teenagers in connection with the disorder that took place on bonfire night on abbeydale road .
the boys , aged 14 , 15 and 16 and from sheffield , have been arrested on sus of violent disorder .
they are in custody being questioned by police .
yesterday two 15-year-old boys , a 16-year-old girl , a 16-year-old boy and a 17-year-old boy were also arrested on sus of violent disorder .
they have now been released on bail pending further inquiries .

documents.title: child abuse inquiry to name institutions
text: the judge leading the independent inquiry into child sexual abuse is set to announce its first investigations this morning .
justice lowell goddard will make a public statement later outlining progress that has been made since the inquiry was formally opened in july .
she is expected to name about a dozen areas that will be examined , including naming a number of institutions in england and wales to be investigated .
south yorkshire police and rotherham council have previously been criticised by the government in the wake of the sexual exploitation of 1,400 children in rotherham .

documents.title: sheffield united : manager promises to be 'ruthless '
text: sheffield united manager nigel adkins has promised to be ruthless as hetries to turn aroundunited 's floundering promotion bid .
blades fans voiced their displeasure during tuesday 's 4-2 defeat at home to shrewsbury .
adkins insists he 'll do whatever it takes to get it working .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: doncaster children 's services response to 'inadequate ' rating
text: doncaster children 's services trust has given its reaction after ofsted inspectors gave them an `` inadequate '' rating .
the trust was set up in october 2014 after the government ordered an arm 's length company take most of the responsibilities for children 's services away from doncaster council .
the chief executive of doncaster children 's services trust , paul moffat has spoken to bbc radio sheffield :
i would suggest that the systems we 've put in place ; the quality of our front line staff , the quality of our management , are improving .
that should give reassurance that children are safer now than they were in 2012 . ''

documents.title: maltby triple fatal crash : emergency services appeal
text: we 're sad to report fire crews attended a road collision last night in which 3 people died .
@ twitterid appeal here

documents.title: travel : delays m1 southbound at barnsley
text: m1 lane closed on exit slip road and queuing traffic at junction 37 a628 barnsley , because of a broken down vehicle .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: maltby triple fatal crash : cars and van collide near colliery
text: south yorkshire police have given more details of a road accident in maltby in which three women were killed yesterday evening .
three vehicles were involved ; two cars going in opposite directions on tickhill road and a van coming out of the entrance to the old maltby colliery .
three women in a red toyota aygo - the driver , aged 58 , and two passengers aged 66 and 76 - all suffered fatal injuries .
a 28-year-old man driving a black ford focus was taken to hospital with serious injuries .
the male driver of the van was not injured .
police are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: breakingthree women killed in maltby crash
text: three women from doncaster have died after a collision in maltby yesterday evening involving two cars and a van , say south yorkshire police .
more to follow .

documents.title: doncaster coroner 's warning after toddler drowns
text: a coroner has issued a warning after an outgoing '' toddler drowned in a garden fish pond while his grandfather was tending to his baby sister , reports the doncaster free press .

documents.title: doncaster children 's services still 'inadequate ' says ofsted
text: children 's services in doncaster have been rated `` inadequate '' again by ofsted inspectors .
an independent trust is now in charge of the service .
the government took control away from the local council two years ago after a number of high-profile cases of neglect .
the head of the trust , paul moffat , says the service might be inadequate but it is getting better .

documents.title: good morning
text: hello sheffield and south yorkshire .
i hope you 're all well this friday morning , i was surprised by a fox crossing the ring road on my way in today .
i 'll be looking after your local live page today , with all the top news stories , sport , weather and travel .
author: Kate Linderholm
BBC Local Live
